headline: Johnson & Johnson Tops Earnings Estimates and Issues a Solid Outlook. The Stock Falls.
summary: Johnson & Johnson  stock was falling even after the multinational pharmaceutical giant posted better-than-expected earnings for the fourth quarter.  The company also issued a solid full-year outlook, guiding for adjusted earnings of $11.53 a share on sales of $100.5 billion.  There was one glaring weakness in the print: Sales of Stelara, formerly one of  Johnson & Johnson’s  biggest sellers, cratered 48% in the quarter.

headline: Reasons Why You Should Retain Fiserv Stock in Your Portfolio
summary: FISV is leveraging SaaS adoption, upgraded payment platforms and strategic acquisitions to drive steady revenue growth in 2026.

headline: United Airlines Beat Fueled By Premium, Loyalty Revenue. Shares Surge To Buy Zone.
summary: United Airlines cleared Q4 views on record revenue, driven by premium sales, loyalty wins. UAL stock to rebound into buy zone.

headline: Charles Schwab Earnings Are Lower Than Expected. The Stock Is Down.
summary: A surge in investor activity boosted  Charles Schwab  profits in 2025, but the company’s fourth-quarter results fell just a tad short of Wall Street expectations.  The company posted adjusted fourth-quarter earnings of $1.39 per share, a penny short of Wall Street analysts’ expectations that it would report adjusted earnings of $1.40 per share.  Fourth-quarter revenue came in at $6.34 billion compared to analyst projections for $6.38 billion, according to estimates compiled by FactSet.
